metadata.title: CVE-2019-12957 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In Xpdf 4.01.01, a buffer over-read could be triggered inFoFiType1C::convertToType1 in fofi/FoFiType1C.cc when the index number islarger than the charset array bounds. It can, for example, be triggered bysending a crafted PDF document to the pdftops tool. It allows an attackerto use a crafted pdf file to cause Denial of Service or an informationleak, or possibly have unspecified other impact.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12957` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
libpoppler-cpp0v5 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
libpoppler111 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
poppler-utils - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: poppler package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.76.1-0ubuntu3').
